characters: THE TOP OF THE DRIVE-IN SCREEN

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: A monolith with alienating foregrounds. A bus pulls in on Beverly. NEIL McCAULEY and a nurse get off. Neil carries a paper bag and wears white pants like a hospital attenda Neil is an ice-cold professional: very big, very tough. At 42 his short black hair is graying. He spent eight years in McNeil and three in San Quentin. He got out and hit the street in 1987. Four of the McNeil years were spent in the hole. Neil's voice is street, but his langua is precise like an engineer's. He's very careful and very good. Neil runs a professional crew that pulls down high line, high number scores and does it anyway the score has to be taken down: if on the prowl (a burglary), that's fine; if they have to go in strong (armed), that's fine too. And if you get in their way, that's got to be your problem. His lifestyle is obsessively functional. There's no steady woman or any encumbrance. Neil McCauley keeps it so there's nothing he couldn't walk from in 30 seconds flat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now, he enters the big double doors and pulls a whi intern's coat from his paper bag.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: We DOLLY on Neil as he crosses through the long crowded corridor. Patients, nurses, interns and doctors pass by. A P.A. broadcasts occasional messages.

dialogues.speaker: PROFILE
dialogues.text: Nail crosses under an "EMERGENCY" sign and keeps going towards the exit doors.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVELING
dialogues.text: Neil APPROACHES THE CAMERA. From the other direction two ambulance attendants wheel an old man under oxygen and pass by Neil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without breaking his stride from the moment he got off th bus, Neil exits through the doors, examines four ambulanc parked in the slots, climbs into one and drives off. Mayb he's stolen it. We don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Converted to PDF by www.screentalk.org            2. EXT. R & C CONSTRUCTION SUPPLIES - ON CHRIS - DAY CHRIS SHIHERLIS crosses past stacks of gravel and cement with a white-coated BLACK CLERK. Chris wears a hard hat over a mongol cut, Levi's, black boots and a sleeveless sweat shirt and carries on one shoulder a 150 lb., red, Milwaukee Tool Company case. He looks like a construction worker by day who by night hits L.A's slams, jams and rav He's 29, from Austin, Texas. Chris is also a highline pro: a boxman who knows five ways to open any safe made. Right now he's buying a hollow core drill. He and McCaule were cellmates in San Quentin Penitentiary from 1984 to 1987. Chris hit the streets in 1988. He's a hot dog and spends money as fast as he makes it. Right now, he and the Clerk exit to the sales counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they approach, the Clerk goes behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you working on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drillin' some post holes into concrete ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: toolcase) With that you can ream solid steel. Check, charge, or cash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash. Put "Jack's Fencing" on the receipt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris pays; Clerk writes receipt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ...that a good racket? I ought to get out from behind this counter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes receipt) Yeah. (beat) Take it easy. He leaves with the heavy red case. Converted to PDF by www.screentalk.org           3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MICHAEL CERRITO - at 40 - is looking at a doll house. He's a wide, thick, coarse-featured big man. Sicilian from Sunnyside, he's spent 15 years in Attica, Joliet and Marion penitentiaries. He's strictly a "cowboy": his natural inclination towards a score is "...get the guns and let's go." He's been off smack and everything else for five years. He's clean and sober. He's the nicest guy on the block and a loving father. If you get in his way, he'll kill you as soon as look at you. If you asked him about the contradictions, he wouldn't know what you were talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's 3 x 6 and two feet high. Miniature room sets are inside. Cerrito's thick fingers close the door. He picks it up. WIDEN. He crosses to a counter and MIDDLE-AGED CLERK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrap this here up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir. You're going to have a happy little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two.   I got two girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. And gimme those three masks there. Clerk takes down Clark Gable, Three-eyed Monster, and Beautiful Lady, full-head rubber masks.

dialogues.text: (continuing) Gimme Donald Duck, too

dialogues.text: (does and laughs) A little early for Halloween?

dialogues.text: She is 29, auburn,  languorous, her eyes are closed and s makes love with her  husband, VINCENT HANNA. Pressing her face to his, their  hair intertwined... It's morning. We are in an expensive  condominium.

dialogues.text: The two bodies locked into the rhythms of their love-maki twisted in white sheets. OFF SCREEN a shower runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is in it. The water streams off his body. The glass is misted. He turns off only the hot and breathes fast in the cold spray. OFF SCREEN a cigarette lighter CLICKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I don't know... (to Hanna) He's already half an hour late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Falls back on the pillow, disappointed. It's as if she'd been stood-up. The bed sheet falls half off of her. She's exposed, vulnerable. She looks out the window, occluded by light muslin, away from us and exhales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bare-chested washing at a sink. WAINGRO'S 27. He sports prison tattoos including an Aryan Brotherhood swastika covering his abdomen. He's a graduate of the "gladiator academies," Chino and Tracy. He's dressed in Army and Navy Store gray workman's clothe He combs his long hair straight back off his round forehe Now he tucks his shirt in and puts on wrap around shades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waits. His shell jacket is in a tight roll under his arm. Then a garbage truck - a Dempsey Dumpster (the kind with power forklift on the front) - pulls up.

dialogues.text: Michael Cerrito is the driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Waingro?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He climbs in. Cerrito pulls out. Waingro - delayed - offers his hand. Cerrito has to wait until he finishes his gear change to shake it. The timing's a little weird. WAINGRO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing loud) You're Cerrito huh? (pause) What kinda guy is this Neil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud) Okay. Just do like he says.    Exactly... like ... he ... says. They have to talk loudly over the clapped-out ENGINE'S NOISE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ABRUPTLY QUIET. The truck's parked. The two men sit idly. Waingro finishes take-out coffee and tosses the empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights a cigarette. Belatedly, he offers one to Waingro. Waingro lights up. The two men relax under the swirls of blue smoke. WAINGRO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This works good, maybe I could go again? Cerrito looks at Waingro.   He wants to protect his concentration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Stop talking, slick... It ends the conversation. Waingro drums his fingernails on the dash. He's anxious.

dialogues.text: TOWNER'S a sloppy, nondescript man in his 40's. He slouch behind the wheel. A Bearcat 210 Scanner is under the dash and a walkie-talkie on the seat. As in the garbage truck, it's quiet and he waits. Then: NEIL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

He and Waingro put them on quickly. Cerrito has the monster mask three eyes and a twisted mou Waingro is a beautiful woman. Their movements now are very fast. Cerrito pulls the truck out of the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Planes ROAR overhead in landings or takeoffs. Yellow vapo lamps glare. It's gaudy with lights. Neil and a man named NATE are parked next to each other facing opposite directions. Nate's 50 - an ex-prize fighter with his nose all over his face in a silver Mercedes. His big muscles have gone to flab. He wears a yellow rayon shirt. He's deeply tanned and pock-narked. Nate functions as a middleman and fence for Neil. All calls from people who want to contact Neil come to Nate. Right now he examines the manila envelope from the armore truck. Neil's in a Lincoln Town car, gray suit, white shirt, no tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: contains 80 x $20,000 negotiable Treasury Certificates. Nate's counting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A million, six at 40 cents onna dollar's 640. Here's a hundred forty thou front money. Get you the rest, 2-3 days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened out there? Converted to PDF by www.screentalk.org   16. NEIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: PAVEMENT
dialogues.text: We're looking at chalk outlines of the bodies of Guard on and Driver from the armored truck. The pavement is bloodstained. Bright lights illuminate the crime scene. HANNA (O.S.)

dialogues.text: Where's the ambulance? HEINZ (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They dumped it four blocks from here... WIDEN TO REVEAL Hanna who we now identify as a police lieutenant of detectives. He's just arrived. The alley's been roped off with sawhorses labeled "crime area." The armored truck with the holed side is still there. One of Hanna's crew, DRUCKER, a black intelligence analyst and technician at 45, was already there. A uniformed SGT. HEINZ was there first and by procedure took command. It's his crime scene. Converted to PDF by www.screentalk.org          18. HEINZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the crash, the white towtruck. Two more of Hanna's crew arrive in an unmarked car and join him: CASALS - bald at 30 and wiry; BOSKO - a huge, oversized man. HEINZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hasn't turned up. Got a witness: janitor next door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I.D. anybody? Plate? Description? HEINZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: According to the janitor, he... (Guard Two outline) Started mouthing off to one of the gunmen. HANNA

dialogues.text: Oh, that was smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figure the other went for... (points) ... that gun when the shooting started. One guy called a guard "slick."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Slick?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   And they ignored the loose cash. Converted to PDF by www.screentalk.org   19.

dialogues.text: 'Cause they had no time, cause they knew our response time, cause they were on our air.

dialogues.speaker: HEINZ
dialogues.text: You recognize their m.o.?

dialogues.speaker: HANNA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Their m.o. is that they are good. Once it escalated into a Murder One beef for all of them after they killed the first two, they popped guard number three 'cause it didn't rake any difference anymore, so why leave a living witness? Drop of a hat? They'll rock and roll. Also: the way they went into the side indicates they are equipped to go in on the prowl. So also start looking for recent highline burgularies that have 'mystified' us. (to Drucker) Run the "slick" bit to the FBI and see what it kicks out.

dialogues.speaker: DRUCKER
dialogues.text: I called it in already.

dialogues.speaker: HANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For those   bucks? 100 per cent. I got the   plastic on me. The passports   will be on the plane. Who's the   third? NEIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much time we got? Hanna turns toward a door. HANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Hanna and Drucker enter. Bosko's there with HARRY DIETER the burglary cop who gave Casals the tip on the bank job. Converted to PDF by www.screentalk.org           120.

dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanna.   Where'd it come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explodes) I got Schwartz. Dead. Casals got no liver. He's dying. Don't come on to me with "confidential source" crap! He slams Dieter into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: HOLD. Then it EXPLODES      off its top binges and hangs disabled. Hanna comes      through with the cut down sled hammer. He's backed up      by Bosko and Berryman - anoth middle-aged heavyweight     - with a regulation 12-gauge.

dialogues.text: You slimy piece of shit.     What a joke. MARCIANO

dialogues.text: What's your end? MARCIANO

dialogues.text: Get the fuck in there! Marciano does. Charlene seems to soften and relax and take satisfaction at Marciano's put-down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (right to his face)

Because he becomes an orphan when you go to prison as an accessory 'cause you got no living parents to take him. Then he ends up state-raised and fucked for life. Your son Dominick's innocent. He didn't choose a life like that. Chris did. Charlene rises and crosses to a bedroom and looks in the door - presumably at Dominick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Give up Chris. You get off clean. Do it for your kid. Charlene sits - shell-shocked - dressed in black with whi face and red lipstick. Marciano re-enters with a drink for her.  Charlene looks towards the bedroom containing Dominick, then nods her head "yes." Farina dials a number Converted to PDF by www.screentalk.org         123.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

(pause) Now Hugh Benny has reformed his wayward life and become a born- again good citizen. So, he's revealed the key player is this cowboy Waingro. Used to be part of Neil's crew. Waingro committed a double murder today on Towner, a driver, and his old lady. (pause) Meanwhile Waingro's checked into the Airport Hyatt House under "Jamieson." Maybe Neil will make a move on him, but not likely. (pause) Get the word to bailbondsmen, bookies, snitches in County, etc. where Waingro is. And get a team down there to set it up. You can walk right now if you want. Walk away. Or you...on your own...you choose to come with me. I got enough in there to take care of us for forever. There's no response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
